content: - Spanish explorer Alonso de Ojeda discovers the island and claims it for Spain.
- Aruba is colonised by the Dutch and forms part of the Dutch West India Company.
- Island is returned to the Netherlands after coming under British rule during the Napoleonic Wars.
- Oil refinery is established at San Nicolaas.
- Aruba becomes part of the autonomous federation of the Netherlands Antilles.
- People's Electoral Movement party (MEP) is founded and begins its campaign for independence and separation from the Netherlands Antilles federation.
- March - Referendum: 82% of voters support independence and withdrawal from the Antillean federation.
- Dutch and Netherlands Antilles governments agree that Aruba should receive separate status from 1986, aiming for independence by 1996.
- 1 January - Island obtains autonomous status within the Kingdom of the Netherlands.
- At a convention in The Hague, the governments of Aruba, the Netherlands and the Netherlands Antilles postpone indefinitely Aruba's transition to full independence.
- Aruba is included on US list of major drug-producing or transit countries.
- Aruba is named as one of 35 "non-cooperative tax havens" by the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD). It is later removed from the list having promised greater openness.
- Aruba, US agree to exchange tax data to help combat money-laundering.
October - Mike Eman becomes prime minister after his Aruba People's Party wins a parliamentary majority, ousting the People's Electoral Movement government of Nelson Orlando Oduber.
October - Mr Eman starts his second term as premier.
July - Aruba detains and then releases top Venezuelan official Gen Hugo Carvajal, wanted by the US on charges of assisting Colombian Farc rebels in drug-trafficking.
